answer: The research opportunity mentioned is a study on the effects of Brazilian Jiu Jitsu and psychotherapy on helping people with autism develop subjective awareness of others. Participants in the study must be between 7-21 years of age, have a diagnosis of Autism Spectrum Disorder, attend Jiu Jitsu classes at least twice a week for six months, and participate in social skills groups or psychotherapy sessions at least once a week.
